website_summaries.verdict: Amazon's top-of-the-line Kindle with gorgeous display and all the bells and whistles. It costs more than other models, but is worth it for anyone who wants a superior reading experience.
pros: Features a 7-inch glare-free screen with sharp 300 pixels-per-inch resolution that provides an outstanding reading experience
Adjusts lighting and turns pages automatically
Ample storage space, reliable WiFi and mobile connectivity and access to Audible are included in its feature set
cons: The build is slightly less ergonomic than previous models
Some minor bugs, including unimpressive battery life and unwanted page turns

website_summaries.verdict: The Paperwhite remains the better overall value, but the updated Kindle Oasis secures its position as the best e-reader if price is no object.
pros: The Kindle Oasis has been upgraded with a new color-adjustable integrated light and is a touch lighter and zippier
It's fully waterproof (it can be submerged) and can play your Audible audiobooks to Bluetooth headphones or speakers
cons: It's expensive, and no case is included
It still uses Micro-USB charging instead of USB-C

customer_reviews.title: Micro-USB is Not Acceptable.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 11th Kindle. Their last Oasis model should have been technology forward enough to have a USB-C charging. The lack of this charging port is totally unacceptable. I am angry over this. EVERY cell phone sold is either USB-C or Lightning. Just a quick walk through a Best Buy will show numerous computers with USB-C charging. Going with a Micro USB port is an insult to the target users of this flagship device. The head of the Kindle project and any engineer that advocated for it should be fired.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is NOWHERE close to advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I received this new Oasis yesterday. I plugged it in so that it could fully charge. As I was setting it up, I watched battery life rapidly decline from 100% to 96% in a matter of minutes. As a test, I left it asleep (no reading/downloading/etc) for ~24hrs. The battery is now at 19%. This is completely unacceptable. Amazon advertises this model as being able to hold a charge for weeks. This experience has demonstrated that a full charge will not even last 48hrs. I cannot in good conscience recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: RCCola

customer_reviews.title: Loving it so far
customer_reviews.text: I have the previous generation oasis as well (on the left side in the pics) and wanted this one for reading at night. Overall there's not many differences between the two, so if the light tone customizability isn't important to you I wouldn't particularly recommend this one over the 9th gen. However, the lighting is noticeably more even with the 10th gen (my older one visibly fades from one side to the other) and there's a ton of variability in the tone of the screen. Overall, for me it was worth it, but your mileage may vary if you don't read in a dark room (so as not to wake the spouse) before bed very often.
customer_reviews.author: Surrealle

customer_reviews.title: Defective Reader or Battery, no support
customer_reviews.text: DEFECTIVE - the battery life is horrible. After two calls to support and two software updates I did a test. I put it to sleep for one hour and the battery declined from 72% to 54%; I read for 5-8 minutes and it declined 5%. A third call to support was: don’t call us, we’ll call you in 3 to 5 business days. I was so looking forward to an upgrade, but this stinks.
customer_reviews.author: G. Knox

customer_reviews.title: Painful to hold.
customer_reviews.text: I am bedridden and I rely heavily on my kindle to keep me from losing my mind. I bought this new one because my old one is dying. It's a 2nd generation and I've used it constantly for years)I'm going to buy another paper white and use it until it dies too. I really hope they continue to make them in perpetuity since the oasis is far too hard to hold. I have advanced arthritis (RA and OA) and holding the oasis is nearly impossible for me and painful too.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Beware Product Trade In Offer
customer_reviews.text: When I upgraded my Kindle to this newest model, I got an offer to trade in my most recent model for up to $50. My older model was still in great shape and works perfectly, so I didn't hesitate. Today, I got a note that said I would be paid only $5, but that I could get a 25% discount on a new Kindle! I just spent $250 on a new Kindle, and you want to pour salt into my wound?
customer_reviews.author: Steve Peter

customer_reviews.title: Battery life 85% to 18% in one day, no use.
customer_reviews.text: I think I have a defective unit, trying to get an RMA now. But woke up yesterday with it dead, charged it up overnight, got to work with 85%, put it up, and when I got out of work it was at 18%... 10hrs and it's nearly dead. Wish me luck on getting a replacement soon.
customer_reviews.author: James Gockel

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd get the Oasis as an "upgrade" from my Kindle Paperwhite. My son and I did an actual side-by-side of the two Kindles, going through the various functions to see how the operating systems functioned side-by-side. While I do think the screen on the Oasis is very cool, the Oasis was not (IMHO) almost $200 better than my old paperwhite. As for waterproof - that's very cool. But on the off-chance that I would drown my current Paperwhite, it would still be cheaper for me to replace it with a new Paperwhite than purchase an Oasis. But, the Oasis is cool for folks who like and need all its features. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Grace

customer_reviews.title: not compatible with some kindle ebooks
customer_reviews.text: it is surprisedly disappoint when finding out the kindle oasis 3 can't support traditional chinese books while paper white and kindle oasis 2 works perfectly fine. All the ebooks I bought before can't be downloaded or read in the new kindle oasis 3.
customer_reviews.author: Li Chen

customer_reviews.title: Defective battery or defective system
customer_reviews.text: Battery is draining 8% to 10% when locked for the whole day. In airplane mode, all day in locked, and no indexing error, it is still draining 8% to 10% battery a day without any use! Be aware! I see other users even have worse battery issues.
customer_reviews.author: Vaiby K.

customer_reviews.title: My charge only lasted two hours.
customer_reviews.text: I thought my Oasis was supposed to hold a charge longer than my old Fire. This afternoon I started out with 100 percent charge, read for two hours, and had to recharge. I am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Torgersen

customer_reviews.title: This is ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: Get a new Kindle. Get Kindle Unlimited for 6 months. Not a single book I want is included in unlimited. Rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Trails!

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - Battery life is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is unacceptable. You can actually watch the battery percentage figure go down...while you watch it. Mine depleted the entire battery overnight. I don’t know what Amazon did to these new readers...but it is not working. Just had Amazon ship me a replacement after just 2 days of attempted use. Sadly, I expect the new one to be the same. If it is...I’ll be looking for a return and full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Earl K Traxler

customer_reviews.title: Frustration and disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my wife on our 72nd wedding anniversary. Sadly to say the battery didn't hold a charge and after fully charging it several times and without using it I observed it fully discharge over a six hour period. I further was scammed when I tried to contact Amazon and an ersatz email address printed out a fake bar code dated July 8,2010. My computer literate daughter pointed out the fallacies of my endeavors and the Kindle Oasis is (hopefully) at this time being returned to Amazon. C. Fred Wilcox, MD
customer_reviews.author: C. Fred Wilcox, MD

customer_reviews.title: Too Many Compromises for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Kindle Paperwhite and a Kindle Voyage years before, and I'm only keeping this Kindle Oasis 3 because I'm trying to read more. Pros: Bigger screen and warm light setting Cons: Still too much lag when typing/tapping/navigating the device, collections and e-book adding process is terrible (was it always like this?), battery life requires more vigilance (use Airplane mode as much as you can), no auto-warmth setting, no 5GHz Wifi support, and no USB-C.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jo

customer_reviews.title: Shame on you Amazon ! No immersion reading on your top of the line when an iPad is callable of it.
customer_reviews.text: Sound, but no immersion reading ? Really? Do they intend to come out with an app or something that makes it possible ? For the same price I could have had the newest ipad which DOES offer immersion reading. This is so stupid, I just wish I could have the ipad on the way, it's beautiful, and have this refunded the moment UPS picks it up. Very unhappy and would buy the last, cheaper model instead of a 100 bucks for a yellow light.
customer_reviews.author: TwistedWhiskers

customer_reviews.title: Could not connect the device to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Bad on me for ordering this at the last minute and not having time to set up my Kindle at home. Bad on Kindle for not recognizing the WiFi at my hotel. It is completely un acceptable. Now I get to travel for three weeks with a useless device and nothing to read. Amazon support was less than helpful. Their best suggestion was to contact the hotel front desk and have them look at the WiFi settings 🤨
customer_reviews.author: Takela

customer_reviews.title: No USB-C you’re kidding me
customer_reviews.text: I get why uncle joe doesn’t want it on the mainline paper white, but this is for super-users who most certainly either HAVE a USB-C device already OR are willing to upgrade to the latest and greatest. This is a huge misstep for a device with a two year lifecycle. My old Kindle died so I came for the tactile buttons and larger screen but this is the last MicroUSB device in my travel bag of >11 battery powered devices in it. Will not be buying another Kindle without USB-C.
customer_reviews.author: J. Toepel

customer_reviews.title: Close to Perfection.
customer_reviews.text: I've had every variation of the Oasis and the Voyage and by far this is my favorite. The crisp on the Voyage was unbeatable until now. The amber lighting helps the screen mimic a physical page to some degree. My only gripes would be Amazon failing to mention that third party cases will not work with this generation. To further explain, third party cases will not trigger the sleep/wake magnets meaning you'll have to turn the kindle on manually. Like others, I agree that the chargers are out dated but I view this as pretty minor. Overall, I love this device.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis La'wynn Ryals

customer_reviews.title: Not at all what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This is not what I expected! I wanted to replace my Kindle 3 but thisis only a book reader. As a book reader, it's fine but very difficult to navigate. There are not enough options for returning to the book you are reading, going to the store or reviewing the books on the devise. While I haven't yet used it a lot, it seems most like the first generation. You can't go online or use it for anything other than books. From the advertisement, I didn't pick this up. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Elve Peck

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it over Kindle paperwhite or competition
customer_reviews.text: I have this and also and older paperwhite, definitely not worth the premium, no question. IF you still want to get the Oasis, strongly consider getting the extra storage. I got the 8gb version but it only has 6gb of usable storage.
customer_reviews.author: amazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: SIZE MATTERS
customer_reviews.text: No one else mentioned this so maybe it's my misunderstanding but ... description reads "Our best 7".......display." But it's NOT 7 inches anywhere! It's actually 6.25 inches including the frame and only 5.5 inches of screen space (4.5 wide). That's smaller than my [original] Kindle Fire which is 7.5 inches tall and 4.75 wide with 6 inches of screen space. Awful!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used to be better
customer_reviews.text: There are better, less expensive products out there for reading.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: battery life is short  The OASIS has worse battery time than with my Paper white.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy several aspects of the new Oasis. It is light, pages turning with the buttons is easy and helps prevent those only to easy erroneously turned pages. Because just touching the screen starts those pages turning and soon you are lost. Being able to flip the Oasis and continue to read with text in the correct position is a great hand saver for those who read in bed. It helps prevent hand cramps. BUT battery life is nowhere near 8 hours of reading. It is closer to 6 of continuous use. So Its use is limited. If you plan to use it for any length of time you must carry the power connector and charge it frequently
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Henry

customer_reviews.title: I'll Stick with my iPad
customer_reviews.text: Why are these so small? Tiny paperback books are bigger. I like to read with black background and white text. Black is not possible, either for background or text. Everything is gray. Contrast, brightness, night mode - all gray. Settings are also confusing. I'm returning this and sticking with the Kindle app on my iPad... large screen, incredible contrast. So underwhelmed by this device. I knew it was going back in the first minute when it was stuck on white screen right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is terrible....and this is the second Oasis 10 I've received with the problem!
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to this new Kindle: amazing battery life, the ability to drop it in a bubble bath and not need a new device, and, especially, the warmth feature on the screen. Though I didn't test the bubble bath theory, I love the warmth feature.......and the battery was drained in about 24 hours. That's in airplane mode, content on the cloud expect for my current read, no Audible, screen brightness at a minimum, software up to date. Amazon handled it beautifully, sending a replacement the same day I reported the problem. And then it happened again. I'll update when the issue gets resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L. Heintz

customer_reviews.title: An excellent product, except for one thing that drives me nuts
customer_reviews.text: I would call this a miracle product. Ability to take 100s of books in your pocket at all times, amazing! One thing I'm almost insulted by is that when the screen is turned off, and also when on the home screen, ADS SHOW UP. Can one pay extra to have them removed? Yes. But the fact it's a $300 gadget and they still place ads is disgusting. I know most don't mind, but I take serious issue with the fact they charge extra to have ads removed from what is already the most expensive ereader on the market. Beyond this, zero complaints. It's smooth as glass from start to finish.
customer_reviews.author: beau bessette

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’m not crazy about the on/off button at the top. It takes forever to turn off. Prefer the one I had. It was at the back and would go off right when you pressed the button. I am also disappointed because this was advertised as having a battery life of several weeks. I’m lucky if mine lasts 2 days. I set my pages as I prefer them but they will not stay as set. I have to go back in and reset it every time.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Shelor

customer_reviews.title: Bedtime reading
customer_reviews.text: I am a long term Kindle owner back to the first one with the physical keyboard and no backlight or touchscreen. My pattern since has been an upgrade every few years with the last being a paperwhite purchased seven months ago. I decided to buy this after I noticed a good deal on a trade-in plus 25% off. The paperwhile is a great device but this is better. I especially like the page buttons, the larger screen, and the warm screen settings. Since I read my books in bed I have already noticed that it is easier to fall sleep after reading. Kindle's have come a long way.
customer_reviews.author: NorthghostTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Feels high end and has a beautiful screen. Battery life a little lower.
customer_reviews.text: Love look and feel. Speed is good, too. Connectivity flawless. Switches between LTE and WiFi as needed. Only downside is battery life. Even in airplane mode the battery drains faster than it did on my 2016 paperwhite. To be fair, I do a lot of reading. I think I’ll need to charge it once a week. That’s significantly more than I had to with my paperwhite with the same reading load.
customer_reviews.author: John David Leckie

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Oasis you are Top Of The Line!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this Kindle! So easy to hold with the right side extra room and the way it’s shaped on the back. With a slight touch of buttons, you can flip pages (FANTASTIC). The lighting is beyond fantastic! I am in heaven with all the new books I am reading. I never had time to read, and now I am 68 and retired; I want to read and learn everything. Amazon, I Love You! You made my world happy with this Wonderful Kindle Oasis! Now that I have Kindle Unlimited, the future is all about books and lots of them!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and beautiful to read from.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent battery life, easy to hold, and crisp text that easy on the eyes for reading in any lighting condition. Tablets and phones I've used over the years and recently, can not compare to the Kindle Oasis. This is the best E-reader / e-book I've ever had. This Version of the Kindle Oasis is highly recommended, because it's the best.
customer_reviews.author: Cybot

customer_reviews.title: Dont trust in tade-in's
customer_reviews.text: I sent my old kindle oasis 8th gen to trade for a new 10th gen. for 60 bucks. I answered two questions: Cracks? does it turn on? After the process and after receiving and paying for my new kindle I was charged 55 because supposedly there were cracks in the screen. That's not true. 5 dollars for a kindle in good condition? I feel really stolen. How to reverse all the process? (return my new kindle get my old one get two refunds) dont think I'll do it. But to let customers know: Beware with trade-inns
customer_reviews.author: Jesús Qui

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed it doesn't support 5ghz wifi!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first kindle, other than kindle for tablets. So far, just by first impressions alone, I do like the screen, especially the warm light. Very quick and snappy but does have a little bit of the normal kindle jitter between screens. Something I've been told I'll get used to. Unfortunately I can not post my full review until Sunday, 2 days from now, when my router and modem gets here. So for now it gets 3 stars. Will update my review when I'm able to get my 2.4ghz wifi up and running. Make sure that your current router supports 2.4ghz wifi. My router never worked on 2.4ghz.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to hold.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Kindle. I previously had a 2nd gen Kindle then a Paperwhite. I loved both of them but missed having the manual buttons on my Paperwhite, so this time I ordered the Oasis. The problem I have with the Oasis is that it slips out of my hand both because the metal case has zero traction and because the side that is meant to be held is heavy. For this reason I am returning the Oasis to get a Paperwhite. I went into Best Buy to check the two current versions of Paperwhite and the waterproof version is very light and the back of the device is made of that rubbery material which provides traction.
customer_reviews.author: genuinekaren

customer_reviews.title: What are the buttons for?
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry, but this is not much of an advancement. The problem with prior models for me was that they constantly advanced the pages when you barely touch the screen. This one is worse. Touching the panel where the buttons to advance or turn back the pages does the trick. Way too sensitive and the unit is heavy and cumbersome, so you have to really hold on and, accidentally, make the device jump ahead one, two or three pages. Needs refinement. I bought one of the first ones shipped. So maybe they'll get better with fixes. Best wait for the bugs to get worked out.
customer_reviews.author: grizzlybill70

customer_reviews.title: No looking back
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about the Oasis! I was hesitant to trade in my Paperwhite, but I’m so glad I did. The amber light and bigger screen are amazing. I thought the ergonomic design would be awkward, but it’s actually quite comfortable, and indistinguishable if you get a case with flat backing. I added pictures to show how you can read it in landscape mode, something I never thought to use on the Paperwhite, but do with the Oasis because of the larger screen and buttons. It’s more responsive and refreshes pages so quickly it makes the Paperwhite feel sluggish. If you’re hesitant, don’t be, especially if you’ve been reading more due to the pandemic. Treat yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery, Not Ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Kindle, so I've been around the block with the tech having owned and loved my Kindle 2 and my Gen 1 Kindle Paperwhite. This latest Oasis does a poor job living up to my previous experiences. * It is heavier than my Paperwhite, * It is wider, which makes it more awkward to hold, * The battery life is surprisingly bad, * I would not call it ergonomic. My wife has the previous Oasis, which is also a much better device. I'm returning this one, a thoughtful Christmas present from my wife. Maybe Amazon will get the next version of the Oasis right.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Not A Good eBook Reader
customer_reviews.text: First off, I wouldn't have bought it if I'd known that it displays ads. The screen is too small. The power button is in the wrong place (keeps getting bumped when I'm reading). A book I purchased displays the forward and the cover page perfectly, but won't page through the cover to the actual book. I have yet to successfully send a pdf file to it. Not a good experience so far. Since buying my first (and only other) kindle (kindle 2) many years ago, there does not seem to be any technological progress (beyond including unwanted ads). Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Cave

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This kindle is not worth the money. The touch screen freezes constantly. Or it shuts down despite being fully charged. It sends error messages for products that have been properly downloaded through Amazon Kindle. I'd return but I didn't keep the packing materials.
customer_reviews.author: Karin E. Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Not as classy feeling as the original Oasis.
customer_reviews.text: I had the original Oasis and upgraded to the 2019 Oasis because I was intrigued by the warm light, larger memory, and larger screen. I knew my Mom would enjoy my well cared for original Oasis. The new Oasis is not as easy to hold with one hand in the case. I haven’t tried it without the case. The original felt really good in one hand. The page buttons seem clickier than the original Oasis. I have been unable to find a non glare screen protector and I’m hopeful one will release soon. Overall I like the larger screen and warm light, but this Oasis just has a cheaper, less streamlined feel than the original.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre—Not enough of an improvement.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not a significant improvement over the last version. Don’t waste your money trading in. Also, be careful about trade ins. Of it takes longer to get your new kindle than the two-week trade-in window, you have to turn in your current Kindle before the new one arrives. I’m returning my new oasis and keeping the former version. For what it’s worth, I’ve attached a photo that shows the new version and it’s immediate predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hardwick

customer_reviews.title: Read the other reviews regarding freezing
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few months but then froze up on the screensaver. It doesn't respond when you try to reset either, nothing. Amazon sent a replacement which came with a scuff and was as slow as a snail in comparison to the original. Amazon offers to send another replacement, to which I politely decline since I'd rather not have to go to the post office again and risk getting infected from this pandemic. Now I see why their workers are complaining, lol. Oh, 30 minutes after writing this review, the replacement froze up now too. Steer clear of this one, I'm not sure about the other Kindles but this one is an expensive paperweight
customer_reviews.author: Servo

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I have owned most every model of the Kindle, including the "old" Oasis. The "new" Oasis is just a bit too large and a bit to heavy as compared with the original Oasis. I was spoiled with the battery life on the "old" Oasis. The new seems to last only about 50 to 60% as long as the original Oasis. I like the water resistant screen, but the "new" Oasis was short of what I expected from the next generation.
customer_reviews.author: MSH

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF TIME AND LOTS OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I returned mine. I couldn't take it. First, I found it next to impossible to pair this thing with any Bluetooth speaker device - like a Bose Mini or cordless earbuds. Then, I had to buy long charging cables and a wall charging station to keep everything charging while I tried to read and listen to the audiobook. I simply returned the whole lot and am currently awaiting a refund. I also cancelled Audible. I spent a fortune on all of this stuff that I was initially very excited to start using. I'm very upset. What a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: BOSTON-STRONG

customer_reviews.title: the battery life is the same old cr*p
customer_reviews.text: Im so mad right now, The promise of a battery that lasted for days instead of hours was one of the reasons I bought this very expensive model and the battery still lasts a maximum of 8/10 hours, even with the minimum brightness, not bluethoot and airplane mode. if you use the wifi on it lasts even less. Its super lightweight and its confy to hold it and the lighting settings are cool but if you are looking for battery life improvement don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for elderly (and everyone else!)
customer_reviews.text: I have one and love it and my sisters and I upgraded our Mom from a Kindle Fire to the Oasis also. She has very limited vision and loves to read and with the Kindle she can adjust the font and light to make reading easier. She is not technically savvy at all but she manages to use it easily and enjoys being able to read outdoors now. We both love the lighter weight as we have arthritic hands. I love the ability to use it in either hand and the large screen. so happy to keep my Mom enjoying her favorite hobby!
customer_reviews.author: Twinknitter

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced!
customer_reviews.text: As far as Kindle goes, this is probably the best one to choose from. I bought the Oasis solely for the warm light feature, which is mandatory for nighttime reading. The Oasis appears and feels to be very sturdy and has a nice ergonomic design to it. Has everything available to customize personal comfort when reading. The price...yeah, you got me, Amazon! I wanted a Kindle for reading and HAD TO buy the Oasis since none of the other Kindle models have the warm light feature. Great marketing call on this cash cow, even if it's a simple feature that could easily be included in all your Kindle products. Well, you certainly trapped the consumer. Good job!
customer_reviews.author: ThatsMrGrinch2U

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product description re: cellular connectivity
customer_reviews.text: The product description does not clearly disclose that the model I ordered was WIFI only. I wasted an hour reading the Kindle Gen 10 manual, trying to connect the device to a cellular network & chatting online. I learned the truth from the chat. So, now I will return the Oasis. Amazon, you lost the sale. I will stick with my old Paperwhite.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Won't ship
customer_reviews.text: They will not ship this to you, they will take your trade-in and not extend it, and they will completely screw you. Support won't help you at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C

customer_reviews.title: The Oasis wasn't...
customer_reviews.text: Was not as good as the Kindle Fire HDX, and the screen is smaller. Returned it...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Service and Problems with Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: The new kindle with warm light I really like what disappointed me was amazons service. I as many had an issue with battery life, Amazon sent me a replacement wich works much better however returning the defective kindle has been a nightmare I am currently out of the US and Amazon wants me to pay 75usd to return a product that did not work properly since I started using it. Kindle Oasis is a top end product but the service is not top end.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Regarding Bluetooth Connection
customer_reviews.text: I am sick and tired of electronic equipment not doing or maintaining what it's supposed to!! When I bought my Kindle, the salesperson assisted in helping me connect a set of headphones to it via bluetooth. Well, after using the Kindle with headphones just once, the connection disappeared and try as I may, I can't connect them! And yes, I've talked with an individual who does this regularly and they can't figure out why it has happened and why it won't connect now. It's ALWAYS something! If I had to do it again, I would forgo the Kindle and just stick with hardback books.
customer_reviews.author: L. Woodrum

customer_reviews.title: Expensive piece of manure!
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money. I've always had Kindle Fires so when I saw the Kindle Oasis I read up on it then decided to get one. Never having had a paper white I thought it would be a high tech Kindle. I wasted my money. Yes it's light to hold, it's waterproof (Amazon says), and has a lot of storage, but it is totally black and white - no color Icons or games. It is awkward to maneuver screens and unless you have Audible, it doesn't have text to voice reading. My old Kindle Fire does so I have wasted my money on this expensive piece of plastic. Live and learn, buy and beware, return or repent.
customer_reviews.author: Lajuana P. Pena

customer_reviews.title: Best Kindle Yet
customer_reviews.text: I love my new kindle oasis,,the product in itself has been a lifesaver for me. I am severely arthritic and holding on to a book or even a paperback is impossible.. one of the joys of my life is reading so I bought a kindle when they first came out. I’ve had a couple of them and the Oasis is my favorite, it’s small and thin to carry in my purse and weighs very little so holding in my hands is comfortable and easy. I also read a lot at night and being able to adjust the lighting through the intensity and warm of the lighting is so nice.i love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: No Color - Grey Scale Only Display a Disappointment !
customer_reviews.text: I just received my new top of the line Kindle Oasis reader and was TOTALLY STUNNED to discover that the screen does not display color. My Kindle app on my iPhone displays magazines and book photos in color and I made the mistake of assuming that the Kindle Oasis reader would at the very least do the same. So I ordered an Oasis for the larger screen and waterproof features. Reading a magazine in black and white is NOT the experience I spent over 300 dollars for. Buyer beware and read the specs carefully and fully before you waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Spraitz

customer_reviews.title: A Step Up from the Two-Part Original Oasis
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I bought a new Oasis is because the original one that I have started to have problems with the battery. The battery life including the covers life, diminished remarkably in the past month or so. And, Amazon offered an excellent credit towards the new oasis when I preordered it. I’m not sure why the Wi-Fi plus cellular version wasn’t available with special offers, and therefore with a $20 reduction in price, but that is the only aspect that isn’t as I expected it to be. I ordered Amazons premium leather cover with my pre-order, and I am very pleased with that cover as well.
customer_reviews.author: JC107

customer_reviews.title: Great in all ways except battery life
customer_reviews.text: Love the Oasis. Great features like auto rotation, scheduling screen warmth and it’s super fast at page navigation. Battery is glaringly less robust than my very aging Paperwhite, however. I have turned off auto adjusting backlight, but still lasts 1/10th of the length of my Paperwhite. It does charge really quickly, but only get about five hours of reading time with backlight set anywhere from 6-11 at all times with cool light for day and warm for night. It’s a little slick to hold with the back being metal, but love the cool feel and it’s very thin. I added a pop socket to aid with handling.
customer_reviews.author: JPeterson

customer_reviews.title: My First Kindle
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Kindle and I wonder what I was waiting for all these years. Usually order my used pocketbooks from Amazon Prime and finally took the jump to the Kindle. I'm 75 and it is a big enough format that I can read the print and bright enough screen for me to see and not have to use a night light for evening reading. Am going to get a lot of enjoyment out of this little piece of technology.
customer_reviews.author: Ualapue

customer_reviews.title: A huge and worthwhile upgrade from the Paperwhite
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from the Paperwhite. The larger display means I get more than two or three paragraphs per “page” which makes it feel much more like a book. The soft backlight is far less jarring than the Timex glow of the Paperwhite which makes reading at night much less strenuous. Yes, the battery life is less impressive than the Paperwhite. Yes, this is very expensive as far as e-readers go but I wouldn’t use anything else after a few weeks with this. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not a good device for daily news and updates
customer_reviews.text: The pixels on the screen changes its color hence reflects light instead of emitting the light. So it is much like reading a book than looking at a tablet or computer screen. The screen refresh is slow, which isn't a big deal. The software / OS is very lame. It doesn't allow 3rd party apps. The experimental browser is terrible. Basically, I spend a lot of time reading news on my phone. I wanted to replace it with Kindle but I am very disappointed. News website or reddit doesnt render properly on the browser. I tried Washington Post subscription on the kindle. They don't offer all the deals they have on the Washington Post website.
customer_reviews.author: Sudip Shrestha

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good with 1 design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I like the warm light feature. Especially for night reading. I don’t like that the collections you’ve created on your other kindle devices will not download. I’m used to forcing these to download on my previous kindle, but with the new oasis you don’t have that option. If you have 47 pages of books to go through, it makes life frustrating to find the next book to read. The battery life is ok. Maybe if I didn’t use it as much as I do then the battery would last longer. Overall this a good kindle and there is just the 1 problem with the collections that Amazon needs to resolve.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Cleaner

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Device!
customer_reviews.text: I will admit I put off purchasing a Kindle for years because I really like reading actual books and the thought of reading on a device did not seem appealing. However, since I am losing storage space in my book cabinets, I finally decided to get a Kindle and I am pleasantly surprised. The Kindle is very easy to read and hold. Having the ability to adjust the light and use the touch screen for navigating is great. Also, the battery life on the device is amazing. It can last quite a bit of time. I am so happy with this purchase. And very happy that I chose a Kindle that I can easily read my favorite books from.
customer_reviews.author: KCT

customer_reviews.title: Jury Still Out On Oasis
customer_reviews.text: I splurged for an Oasis but after 2 weeks it froze on lock screen and would not unfreeze. Amazon sent me a new one but now I’m leery about it. I mainly bought it because of the larger screen which I like because I read large print. I rarely use audible on Oasis because I use my phone app. If it had a speaker I’d use audible on Oasis more often. I like the warm light. Will update this review at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: arussellga

customer_reviews.title: You Want This!
customer_reviews.text: I am so very surprised and pleased with the Kindle Oasis. I did not expect the small changes to make such a difference! The ergonomic design is great. If you want to hold it with your left hand you simply turn it around and the pages reorient and become right side up. I use the warm light feature at night so as not to disturb my husband with a bright light. Any Kindle user needs the Oasis!
customer_reviews.author: tutusherry

customer_reviews.title: cool reader, but designed as a Money Maker
customer_reviews.text: The device itself is pretty cool, no complaints about the hardware. It is super light, easy to read, easy on power consumption. However, the interface is not user friendly, really no help function that I can figure out. Some basic commands like deleting content, are buried deep in pull downs. If one has a question, best to go online. I have found it is easier to "manage" on my computer and then it communicates with the Kindle. It is set up to sell sell sell. I understand the business model, but ... ugh. Another thing I noticed, magazines just don't read the same, hard to get the feel of an article, especially if it includes graphics.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about the new Oasis except the battery
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the Oasis 8th edition with this new Oasis. It's a great reader with the exception of battery life - in or out of airplane mode the battery does not last weeks. When I received the Oasis I downloaded the unread books in my library and then recharged the battery, the battery then lasted a day or two before needing recharging. I reset the Oasis and just downloaded the book I was currently reading and the battery still drains ridiculously fast. I will call customer support tomorrow, battery life is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Chin Lady

customer_reviews.title: This is what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of reading on shinny screens and heavy tablets. Most of the times I was out of concentration as once I started reading I was distracted for whatever reason you can imagine: upgrades, e-mails, checking old files, listening music, watching videos, etc. With my new kindle Oasis I finished with all the distractions. It is comfortable to carry it for long times with one hand only. I like the buttons to change pages and he most important for me: my eyes are not stressed any more.
customer_reviews.author: Many

customer_reviews.title: Great device - I’d buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints. I bought a paperwhite back in 2013 and didn’t use it very often. This year I started using it again and a lot! I decided I should upgrade because honestly, I wanted the buttons for page turning. I’ve been very happy with this device. The buttons make such a big difference and it’s nice to have that open space for holding with a better grip. I usually read for 3-4 hours at a time and I haven’t had any issues with battery life. When it gets low I charge it and it’s fine. I’m very satisfied and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Mac

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my iPad
customer_reviews.text: Bought the high-end Oasis an after only aa month I find I'm doing most of my reading on my iPad. The Oasis is awkward to hold, the screen is much smaller than I expected, battery life is so-so, and having to use a headphone for any audio is a pain. Hell, even a phone has a speaker. In all, I find the Oasis not worth the money, the iPad has page turns where the kindle just flashes for page transitions, all this means that for an almost $300, the Kindle Oasis is short on features. For a few dollars more you can buy an iPad with any more features in a book-sized form-factor.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Original Kindle Oasis better.
customer_reviews.text: I have had every Kindle made and I prefer the original Oasis, it was smaller, lighter and easier to take around. The new one is heavier and I have had multiple hand surgeries so that bothers me. I don't really think the new light is such a big deal, it's ok. I wish that they had a speaker for the audible so you could just lay it down and let it read to you without the annoyance of headphones. I am really glad that I did not trade in my old one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Palmeri

customer_reviews.title: Ads? For $300?!
customer_reviews.text: $300?! And it has ads?! I can get a nintendo switch for $100 less with significantly better hardware and no ads. What a bunch of bs. By the time you pay to remove the ads you are at the same cost as an IPad! Just get an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Charge The Battery Often
customer_reviews.text: The warm light is GREAT and makes it much more pleasant to read at night. But the battery life is WAY shorter than my Voyage (which I used daily for four years). You probably have to charge it once a week, which isn’t a huge hardship for how nice then screen is—and it charges quickly. But it is kind of annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A Haungs

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Server problems/Cover Art
customer_reviews.text: So the Kindle Oasis 10th gen. itself I cannot review yet. I have spent all my time trying to get 1/2 my Book Cover art to download to no avail. I called tech support x2 , no one knew. Tried factory reset, software update, toggle from list to grid view. Finally I found a forum that said it was Amazon Server and may take weeks or never upload properly. So now I have to keep it in list view which I cannot stand, I like to see my Book Covers, make it feel more like a book. Amazon if you reading please help me with this so I can update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Oasis- getting to know (still kinda miss my old Kindle)
customer_reviews.text: I only have about 10 hours reading it so far. Still trying to get used to how to hold the new design. Has an annoying habit of jumping back a page when my left hand brushes the bottom corner. Battery life seems very good so far. Automatic lighting adjustment has not been a value added feature for me.
customer_reviews.author: wildcat79

customer_reviews.title: Best ereader I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had about 10 ereading devices - Kindles, Nooks, Kobos, tablets and others, and this is my favorite. I like the size of the screen and the way it’s illuminated. I always buy covers so the cold feel of the aluminum doesn’t affect me. I almost deducted a star because when I choose how to measure progress it won’t stay. Page no. will change to percent read, to time left in chapter, or to nothing, I have to keep manually changing it. Otherwise, it is the best ereader I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.author: snoopy pete

customer_reviews.title: Great product, absurd pricing
customer_reviews.text: This is only a marginal improvement over my Paperwhite, but even the least equipped model is twice the price - this is my only, but significant, complaint about the Oasis. Its better - but its in no way twice the device. Amazon shouldn't be selling unlit Kindles any more then unlit Kindle Fires, its just an unnecessarily bad experience I wouldn't want customers to have even for the discount. The Paperwhite should be the base model, the Oasis the premium, and their pricing shift down to the lower tier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Generally... great!
customer_reviews.text: I love my oasis. Great battery life. I charge it about once per week even reading with the back light on all of the time and always connected to wifi and occasionally Bluetooth. The screen is that wonderful ultramatte that blurs out bright lights so as to reflect them much less than other devices' screens. In my opinion, that and the warm/cool color temp and many LEDs are what you're really paying for. It is considerably more expensive than the other Kindle, and for that I wouldn't 100% recommend it unless you have spare cash to burn. I bought a parent the paperwhite, and they love it despite the fewer LEDs and no adjustible warm white light function.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I *love* it !!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a regular Kindle Paperwhite for years now, and honestly, I loved it too. But I was intrigued by the larger screen on the Oasis, and decided to try out the current generation which is getting very good reviews. So today was its first hiking trial, and it is Wonderful!! Beautiful, I love the larger screen, touch system is *very* responsive. Battery life is so-so; after one afternoon of use, it has dropped to 75%, but frankly that's no worse than the Paperwhite was; I always carry an extended battery with me in case my reader decides to be discharged when I need it. I am very happy with my new Kindle!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice high quality b&w reader. Easy on the eyes. Good battery
customer_reviews.text: A very nice quality digital reader. Preferable to using phone or pc Kindle app. I use mine for both books & manga. It would be nice if Amazon would release a color kindle (there are competitors that offer color alternatives) and it would be nice if 1. Amazon would expand their digital library further or 2. Allow for competitor's apps to run on the machine, for properties that Amazon has chosen to take a pass on. Definitely doesn't help that not too long Amazon was removing titles from their digital manga/comic library. Anyways, the item itself is really nice. ...but, yeah, allowing competitor apps would fix the selection issue.
customer_reviews.author: Gevin Huey

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and fits in my handbag.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I’ve read 246 pages and have 46% of my battery left. I bought the premium leather cover. Before it arrived, I found the Kindle slippery to hold. I STRONGLY recommend purchasing a cover. This is my reason for a 4 rating rather than 5. This is my second Kindle. My last one had a light that pulled out of my cover. The new lighted Kindle is much better. The version I purchased provides even lighting. While water resistant, don’t plan on reading while scuba diving. 😂
customer_reviews.author: dinat

customer_reviews.title: Crappy warranty and customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Device stopped working 32 days after I got it-frozen screen that wouldn’t reset. Customer service sent me a used “refurbished” device because it was more than 30 days after I bought this $350 device. I did not damage the device or drop it-it just literally froze. I don’t think the correct customer service response should be to send a used device less than 2 months out due to a defective device. The battery life is also greatly overstated. Can’t comment on the refurbished device because I opted for a refund. If I wanted a used device that’s what I would have bought. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Pokemommy

customer_reviews.title: Does not hurt when it slaps me in the face!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my Kindle Oasis! I’ve had it a little over a month now & I am so happy with it! It’s lightweight. It doesn’t hurt when it slaps my in the face after I doze off reading (which is super important!). But, the best part is the fact that I can turn it so that it’s user friendly for us south paws (left handed people). This is my binky & am so happy I finally bought myself something that I love & use literally every day!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra K

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this Kindle!
customer_reviews.text: I’d hesitated to buy this because it’s expensive. I loved my Paperwhite and Fire, and thought, “How much better could the Oasis be, really”? It is THAT much better! Virtually perfect, as far as I can see!
customer_reviews.author: M. lewis

customer_reviews.title: Wish the Warm Color was on the Other Models
customer_reviews.text: Love the device, only paid the premium for the warm light because the cool light hurts my eyes in the dark. I don’t use any of the other features exclusive to this model so I wish the warm light was available on the lower priced models. Was disappointed to find out that only the graphite device comes with cellular connectivity. Total oversight on my part when I purchased it and had been trying to connect to cellular for months. Solid product if you use all the features. Be sure to pay close attention to cellular option when buying if you want it.
customer_reviews.author: Fed

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reading device
customer_reviews.text: I loved my old Kindle, but it was slow and kinda unconfirmed to hold for long periods of time. Not the case with the new 2019 Oasis. This thing is super responsive to touch and rotation. I actually use the hardware buttons more than I expected for turning pages, just because they're right where my thumb is resting naturally. The little bump in the back feels more like holding a folded book. I take this to the gym every day and read for a couple hours while I'm jogging on the treadmill - helps keep me going, as I always want to finish just one more chapter, which results in extra exercise and better commitment to my fitness goals.
customer_reviews.author: Kep

customer_reviews.title: I really love this Kindle device
customer_reviews.text: I really love this Kindle device in that it's light weight with a long lasting battery as long as you don't have the backlit screen cranked all the way up. On a setting of 25% ~ 33% the battery should last several weeks easy. I really like the design but a case is an absolute must because it's far better and more comfortable to hold and it won't let you scratch you device. I purchased my with 32 gigs of storage and personally anything less than 32 gigs is a shame because once you start reading on this beautiful device you'll be wanting to purchase a bunch more books.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: Can not use as I wanted or need. Terrible web browser. Fire was better but lacked speed and battery life. Contemplating returning item.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond C. Dell Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great for elderly
customer_reviews.text: Bought for elderly parent who had a kindle with buttons but no backlight. Decided time to upgrade for all she does for me. Expensive but she is worth it Gave it to her and she loves it. Can adjust font size easy to use. In times of covid easy way to get books. I have paperwhite and after seeing oasis I am jealous. Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: Doodah

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and eye pleasing adjustable warm light
customer_reviews.text: I love to read and have been wanted a kindle for a long time. I finally did it and I am I glad I did! I love the warm lighting feature that automatically adjusts to the light in the room. I also love that I can flip it around and change the hand I hold it with because I have herniated discs in my thoracic spine so my arms and hands go numb constantly. Having the ability to change the hand in which I hold the kindle gives me a more enjoyable reading experience. Setup was super easy as well. I would definitely recommend this model!
customer_reviews.author: B Phipps

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement Over My Old Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I've had my old Kindle since 2009. In that time it has literally traveled the world with me and been used daily. When I saw this version with the warm lighting feature, I retired old faithful and bought an Oasis. It is light and durable and well made. It is easy to use but takes a little getting used to the touchscreen. The only drawback so far is that the dictionary only displays in small type when you use it. It is possible this could be adjusted, but I haven't figured that out yet. Overall a good unit and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Happy Reader
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know all the technical stuff with these devices. The Oasis was pricey, but with the deal and the trade in value, I decided to upgrade from my old paperwhite (due to charging issues). Easier reading with the warm light. I don’t know why and I don’t care, but it works. Haven’t dropped it in water yet so I can’t verify the waterproof viability, but I trust they wouldn’t make the claim unless it was valid. Too easy for people to prove it wrong. Charging is smooth and fast. Doesn’t hold charge for weeks but I go several days in between and I read a lot! Very happy so far! I do love my Kindle! Happy reading!
customer_reviews.author: NWJackie

customer_reviews.title: Don't have wi-fi, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a person who liked "books", as in the feel, the quality of the paper, fingering the paper while reading, seeing the visual size of a book for a long read, or a short one. I wanted to try the top of line e-reader and chose the Oasis because of screen size and lighting options. I also have no wi-fi, and was told by several buyers and help line that I could not get books on it without it. WRONG!!!!!! Takes some computer dexterity, but it definitely CAN be done by just moving files. So, I enjoy reading like this, it's lighter, and I don't have to have a light on.
customer_reviews.author: Dy

customer_reviews.title: Good device, but Not Worth Premium
customer_reviews.text: It’s not worth the premium price over the paperwhite, it’s also too wide to fit in a pocket comfortably now. And no usb-c is disappointing. Reader still easy to see even on daylight and battery lasts a month or more (I do use airplane mode a lot since kindle is for long form reading for me)
customer_reviews.author: beachmaker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device but not too responsive
customer_reviews.text: I love the reader, but I do have one complaint. It is not as responsive as I thought. I thought the new version will be much quicker, but it still responds like a 2005 device. For example, it take more than a full second for the password screen to come up, and I have to punch in the numbers one. digit. at. a. time. - with care, too!
customer_reviews.author: Faye An

customer_reviews.title: Easy reading soft on eyes
customer_reviews.text: I am so used to reading books and turning pages with the feeling of just holding a book gave me pleasure so I was a little hesitant in purchasing a Kindle. When I started using my Kindle and became familiar with the features I was very pleased how much I enjoyed it. Looking forward to much more pleasure reading . The Kindle is small and compact enough to carry everywhere I go so I am never bored when riding in a car or just on the wait train somewhere. Love my new Kindle if you are a reader I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Donna N.

customer_reviews.title: Like it, don't love it
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded from the OLD kindle with the keyboard. I like the backlight feature and the page flips to make the buttons right hand or left hand. I wish there was more space to hold the kindle around the screen. I'm constantly bumping the screen and changing the page. Honestly, I would like to be able to turn off the touch screen feature all together. Also, the battery doesn't last nearly as long as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: A good product made even better
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long-time Kindle user who likes the improvements of the Oasis. These are not earth-shaking but are appreciated: longer battery life; quicker charge; screen display refinements; the button to flip pages (which adds to, but doesn't replace, the page-touch); the thin leather case (optional) -- nice but doesn't always open up conveniently and hangs a little oddly, but that's very minor. Slightly larger size (bigger battery?) but that's OK too. We'll see if it lasts as well as my old Kindle. It seemed a little pricy, but so's everything. I'm happy with it -- and I have my old Kindle as auxiliary backup!
customer_reviews.author: Norval Settle

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from original kindle oasis 1017. This one is much bigger and the battery is much better. It is however heavier.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Dzomba

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Received as gift so feel I must keep it. I really don't like this Kindle. I've been using an old kindle fire and it is so bright and clear and easy to read. This is really dim and rather grainy. I've adjusted lightening, pitch size, etc. and it just isn't the same bright easy read. I realized that this look is probably because it's supposed to look like a page in a book which normally isn't bright and white. Guess you can get used to anything so I will use but don't like and really hard on my eyes. I do like size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Fairy

product_meta.title: Kindle Oasis – Now with adjustable warm light – Ad-Supported
feature_bullets: Our best 7", 300 ppi flush-front Paperwhite display.
Adjustable warm light to shift screen shade from white to amber.
Waterproof (IPX8) so you can read in the bath or by the pool.
Thin and light ergonomic design with page turn buttons.
Reads like real paper with the latest e-ink technology for fast page turns.
Instant access to millions of books, newspapers, and audiobooks.
Works with Audible - pair with Bluetooth headphones or speakers to switch seamlessly between reading and listening.
